Description: Fragment of oval handle of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora, with gradual curve. Clay accreted; very hard fired. Rectangular stamp. Greek inscription. Finger mark to right of stamp.
Curator's comments: Petrie Diary 1884-5 (EES Archive XVII 47) p. 52 6, 101a 31 or 206,23. Perhaps from same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABC 0373.09.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0460)
